marketNews.title: OECD Again Cuts RI Economic Growth Outlook
marketNews.content:
Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) again cut its projection for Indonesia's economic growth to +4.7% YoY in 2025 and +4.8% YoY in 2026 in an outlook released in early June 2025, respectively 0.2 percentage point lower than the outlook in March 2025. This also marks the second downward revision for Indonesia this year, following the downgrade in March 2025.
Besides the outlook for Indonesia's economic growth, OECD again cut the projection for global economic growth to +2.9% YoY in 2025 and 2026, which is 0.2 and 0.1 percentage point lower, respectively, than the outlook in March 2025. This marked the second downward revision of the global economic growth outlook by the OECD after March 2025, influenced by risks of significant slowdowns in several advanced economies - such as the US, Canada, and Mexico - along with increasing trade barriers and geopolitical uncertainties.
Although the weakening global economic growth also puts additional pressure on developing countries, OECD confirmed that the downgrade in Indonesia's economic growth outlook is mainly due to domestic factors, not the direct impact of US import tariff policies. OECD stated that Indonesia's export contribution to the US is less than 2% of Indonesia's GDP, making the direct influence of US tariff policies quite limited.
Specifically, OECD noted that private consumption and investment in Indonesia will be suppressed in the first half of 2025, along with weakening business and consumer sentiment, uncertainty in fiscal policy direction, and high borrowing costs. On the external side, increasing global trade tensions and declining commodity prices are also expected to burden Indonesian exports, reflected in BPS data showing an export contraction of -10.77% MoM in April 2025.
OECD projects domestic demand in Indonesia will gradually recover in 2H25 to 2026. OECD also forecasts inflation in Indonesia will move towards 2.3% in 2025 and 3% in 2026, following the expiration of electricity tariff discounts and the effect of Rupiah depreciation. Furthermore, public investment spending through Danantara IDR is considered to have potential as an investment recovery catalyst. However, OECD also warns of additional risks from potential capital outflows from Indonesia, due to both global and domestic uncertainties. This pressure could suppress the Rupiah exchange rate, widen the current account deficit, and increase the risk of imported inflation.
In 2025 itself, the government is targeting economic growth of +5.2% YoY. However, Indonesia's economic growth in 1Q25 only reached +4.87% YoY (vs 1Q24: +5.11% YoY, 4Q24: +5.02% YoY) - lower than the government's 2025 target of +5.2% YoY - with household consumption slowing to +4.89% YoY (vs 1Q24: +4.91% YoY). Following this data, Bank Indonesia cut its economic growth target for 2025 from +4.7-5.5% to +4.6-5.4%, marking the central bank's second downgrade this year.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content:
We assess that the impact of the second round of the government's economic stimulus package launched during the June-July 2025 school holiday period may be a key factor in maintaining short-term economic growth. In the long term, we assess that Indonesia's economic growth will be influenced by several factors, such as the acceleration of government spending, the utilization and management of Danantara investment funds, the prospect of interest rate cuts to encourage economic growth, and improved investment climate following trade war de-escalation. Having a diversified portfolio across various asset classes can help minimize the impact of market volatility, especially amid risks of economic slowdown. With the prospect of future interest rate cuts to boost economic growth, investors can consider investing in short-tenor government bonds that still offer attractive risk-reward:
1. SR022-T3 (3-year tenor, yield 6.45%)
2. PBS003 (approx. 2-year tenor, yield approx. 5.93%)
3. PBS032 (approx. 1-year tenor, yield approx. 5.73%)

marketNews.title: OJK Issues Regulation on Health Insurance Co-payment
marketNews.content: OJK issued circular letter number 7 of 2025 which requires health insurance products to implement risk sharing (co-payment) borne by the policyholder of at least 10% of the total claim submission, with a maximum limit for outpatient care of IDR 300 thousand per claim and maximum inpatient care of IDR 3 million per claim. The circular letter also allows insurance companies to implement higher maximum limits for co-payment, as long as it is agreed upon between the company and the policyholder. This policy only applies to indemnity principle health insurance products and managed care scheme products, and excludes microinsurance products.

marketNews.title: ESDM Sets Benchmark Coal Price (HBA) for June 2025
marketNews.content: The Ministry of ESDM set the Benchmark Coal Price (HBA) for the first period of June 2025 down -16.7% MoM to US$100.97 per ton. This HBA is also down -8.5% compared to the HBA in the second period of May 2025.

marketNews.title: Nickel Oversupply Expected to Persist Until 2027-2028
marketNews.content: Macquarie Analyst, Jim Lennon, stated that the oversupply in the global nickel market is expected to persist until 2027-2028 as demand growth slows amid capacity expansion. Nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange recently hit a 5-year low, dropping to US$13,865 per ton on April 7, 2025, before creeping up to US$15,380 per ton on Thursday (5/6). Lennon stated that the US$15,000 per ton level is a crucial level for producers, considering half of existing producers will risk losses if nickel prices remain below that level. Nickel demand growth is slowing due to the surge in the use of its substitute, the cheaper lithium iron phosphate batteries. Reuters reported that the analyst consensus has cut the estimate for nickel demand in the battery sector in 2030 to only 967,000 tons (vs. 2024 realization: 518,000 tons), much lower than the consensus estimate made 2 years ago at 1.5 million tons.

marketNews.title: Singapore Banks Provide Largest Rupiah-Denominated Data Center Loan in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Singaporean banks consisting of DBS and UOB announced they have provided a total loan of IDR 6.7 trillion to finance the development of a data center owned by Singaporean company DayOne and the Indonesia Investment Authority (INA). Reuters reported that this loan marks the largest rupiah-denominated financing ever in the data center sector. The loan will be used to develop and operate 3 data centers with a total capacity of 72 MW in Batam, with construction targeted for completion in 2025.

marketNews.title: JECC Controller Increases Stake
marketNews.content: The controller of Jembo Cable Company ($JECC), PT Monaspertama Persada, bought 53.1 million JECC shares at IDR 600 per share on June 2, 2025, which is -43.9% lower than the company's share price at the market close on the same day at IDR 1,070 per share. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 31.9 billion. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Monaspertama Persada in JECC increased from ~52.57% to 59.59%.

marketNews.title: ISSP Controller Increases Stake
marketNews.content: The controller of Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia ($ISSP), PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, bought 6.8 million ISSP shares at IDR 296 per share on June 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 2 billion. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra in ISSP increased from 56.3% to 56.4%.

marketNews.title: Lesson from DCII and Operating Leverage
marketNews.content: "Companies with high operating leverage might look expensive initially. But they will actually look cheap in the future when their net profit starts to explode" - fadhilonn

tickerNews.title: UNTR Eyes Gold & Nickel Mine Acquisitions Abroad
tickerNews.content: United Tractors Director, Iwan Hadiantoro, said that the company is exploring opportunities to acquire mineral mines - such as gold and nickel - overseas to increase the proportion of non-coal revenue in the future. Iwan mentioned that UNTR is quite aggressively searching for new mineral mines in Australia and Canada, considering that the majority of large-scale mineral mines in Indonesia are already owned by other companies and are not for sale. Iwan explained that UNTR has monitored almost all mineral mines in Australia - especially in Western Australia and Queensland - but the company has not yet reached an agreement with the owners of the mines it intends to acquire in Australia. Iwan estimates that the CAPEX requirement for acquisition ranges from 500 million to 1 billion US dollars within 1 year.

tickerNews.title: GS Supermarket taken over by FoodHall (MAPI), rebranded to Daily Supermarket
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Retailers and Shopping Center Tenants Association (Hippindo), Budihardjo Iduansjah, stated that the operations of GS Supermarket in Indonesia have been taken over by FoodHall Indonesia, which is operated by Mitra Adiperkasa. Budihardjo mentioned that the memorandum of understanding for this transaction was signed in early June 2025. The GS Supermarket brand in Indonesia was renamed Daily Supermarket on June 1, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Awaits Danantara Share Acquisition Review
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia Corporate Secretary, Wisnu Sunandar, stated that the company cannot provide further details regarding rumors of share acquisition by BPI Danantara, as this is under the authority of the shareholders. Previously, the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, confirmed early this week that there are plans to separate BRIS from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). Erick mentioned that the Ministry of SOEs will await a study from Danantara regarding this corporate action before making a decision.

tickerNews.title: COCO Plans Rights Issue Up to 8.5 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Wahana Interfood Nusantara plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 8.5 billion new shares. The exercise price has not yet been announced, while the proceeds are intended for business development. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on July 15, 2025.

tickerNews.title: NISP Plans Bond Issuance Up to IDR 1.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP plans to issue bonds up to IDR 1.5 trillion, with proceeds intended for business growth in the form of lending. The bond consists of 3 series, but the respective interest rates have not yet been announced. The bond has received an AAA(idn) rating from PT Fitch Ratings Indonesia. The public offering schedule runs from June 26-30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GHON to Distribute Cash Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Gihon Telekomunikasi Indonesia will distribute a cash dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of approximately IDR 99 billion or IDR 180 per share. This amount is equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of ~117% (vs. 2023: ~91%) and indicates a dividend yield of 9.9% as of Thursday (5/6). The cum date on the regular and negotiation markets is June 12, 2025, while payment date is July 2, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TOTO Shareholders Approve Final Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Surya Toto Indonesia shareholders on Wednesday (4/6) approved the distribution of a final dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately IDR 248 billion, equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of ~79% (2023: ~77%). This amount indicates a final dividend of 12 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 5.3% as of Thursday (5/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced. Previously, TOTO distributed an interim dividend of 12 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: DSNG Shareholders Approve Cash Dividend Payout for 2024
tickerNews.content: Dharma Satya Nusantara shareholders approved a cash dividend distribution plan for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately IDR 254 billion or 24 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of ~22% (vs. 2023: ~28%) and indicates a dividend yield of 3% as of Thursday (5/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced.
